text: Idle Forge: Game Design Document

A fantasy blacksmithing idle game where players build and automate a legendary forge. Gather ores, smelt metals, craft weapons, and fulfill orders from adventurers to grow your reputation and unlock ancient recipes.
Core Loop
Gather — Mines passively produce ores over time. Upgrade mines to increase yield and unlock rarer ore types.
Smelt — Furnaces convert raw ores into ingots. Different alloy recipes combine multiple ore types for superior metals.
Craft — Anvils turn ingots into weapons and armor. Each item has a quality roll influenced by forge temperature and smith skill.
Sell — Adventurers visit the shop with orders. Filling orders earns gold and reputation. Higher reputation attracts wealthier clients.
Expand — Spend gold to build new stations, hire apprentices, and unlock enchanting. Each expansion multiplies throughput.
Resources
Ores — Copper, Iron, Silver, Gold, Mythril, Stardust. Each tier unlocks through mine upgrades.
Ingots — Smelted from ores. Alloys (Bronze, Steel, Electrum, Adamantine) require specific ore combos and furnace level.
Gold — Primary currency. Earned from orders, spent on upgrades and expansion.
Reputation — Prestige currency. Attracts better clients and unlocks legendary recipes. Soft-resets on Rebirth.
Ember Shards — Prestige currency earned on Rebirth. Permanently boost all production rates.
Buildings & Stations
Mine

Passively generates ores every few seconds. Each mine level increases output rate by 25% and every 5 levels unlocks the next ore tier. Players can own multiple mines. Idle production continues while offline (capped at 8 hours).
Furnace

Converts ores into ingots over time. Basic furnace handles one ore type at a time. Upgraded furnaces can process alloy recipes (2-3 ore inputs). Furnace temperature affects smelt speed — fuel (coal, charcoal, dragonbreath) determines temperature tier.
Anvil

Crafts weapons and armor from ingots. Each recipe requires specific ingot types and quantities. Craft time varies by item complexity. Quality roll (Common/Uncommon/Rare/Epic/Legendary) based on smith skill + anvil level. Higher quality items sell for exponentially more gold.
Enchanting Table

Unlocked at Reputation level 10. Adds magical properties to crafted items (Fire Damage, Lifesteal, Sharpness, etc.). Enchanting consumes Rune Dust (rare mine drop). Enchanted items fulfill special client requests worth 3-5x gold.
Shop Front

Adventurers arrive with orders on a timer. Each order specifies an item type, material, and optional enchantment. Filling orders earns gold + reputation. Unfilled orders expire after a timeout. Upgrading the shop increases the number of simultaneous order slots (1 to 5).
Progression & Unlocks
Progression is driven by Reputation, which acts as the player's overall level. Key milestones:
Rep 1 — Start with 1 Copper Mine, 1 Furnace, 1 Anvil, 1 Shop slot
Rep 3 — Unlock Iron ore tier, 2nd mine slot, Bronze alloy recipe
Rep 5 — Unlock Apprentice hiring (auto-craft), 2nd shop slot, armor recipes
Rep 10 — Unlock Enchanting Table, Silver ore, Steel alloy, special client orders
Rep 15 — Unlock Gold ore, Electrum alloy, 3rd shop slot, Legendary quality tier
Rep 20 — Unlock Mythril ore, Adamantine alloy, Rebirth option becomes available
Rep 30 — Unlock Stardust ore (post-rebirth only), Celestial weapons, endgame client tiers
Rebirth (Prestige System)

At Rep 20+, players can perform a Rebirth. This resets gold, ores, ingots, reputation, and building levels back to zero. In return, the player earns Ember Shards based on their reputation at the time of rebirth.
Ember Shards are permanent and provide global bonuses:
+5% ore production per shard
+3% craft speed per shard
+2% quality roll bonus per shard
Every 10 shards unlocks a permanent perk (auto-smelt, bulk orders, rare ore chance, etc.)
Each rebirth should feel noticeably faster than the last, letting players reach new content (Stardust tier, Celestial recipes) that was previously out of reach.
Automation & Apprentices

Apprentices are the core automation mechanic. Each apprentice is assigned to a station and works it automatically. They have their own skill level that improves over time, increasing speed and quality at their assigned station.
Miner Apprentice — Auto-collects ore, prioritizes highest tier available
Smelter Apprentice — Auto-queues smelting jobs, follows a configurable recipe priority list
Smith Apprentice — Auto-crafts items, can be set to craft-to-order (match incoming orders) or craft-for-stock
Shopkeeper — Auto-fills orders from inventory, prioritizes highest-value orders first
Client System
Clients are procedurally generated adventurers who visit the shop. Each has a name, class, and order request. Client tiers scale with reputation:
Commoners (Rep 1-5) — Simple copper/iron requests, low gold reward
Mercenaries (Rep 5-10) — Steel/silver requests, moderate gold, sometimes request specific quality
Knights (Rep 10-20) — Gold/electrum requests, high gold, often require enchantments
Heroes (Rep 20+) — Mythril/adamantine requests, massive gold, always require enchantments and Rare+ quality
Legends (Post-Rebirth) — Stardust/celestial requests, extreme rewards, unique named characters with lore
Economy & Balance Notes
Ore production scales linearly; costs scale exponentially. This creates natural plateaus that encourage lateral expansion (more mines) over pure leveling.
Quality multipliers: Common 1x, Uncommon 2x, Rare 5x, Epic 15x, Legendary 50x. This makes quality upgrades the primary gold scaling lever.
Target session lengths: first rebirth at ~2 hours of active play. Subsequent rebirths progressively faster (30-60 min each). Offline catch-up capped at 8 hours to prevent runaway gains.
Enchanting serves as a gold sink and engagement hook — rune dust is scarce enough to require active decisions about which items to enchant.
Design Pillars
Satisfying Automation — The joy of building a self-running forge. Every upgrade should visibly increase throughput. Players should feel like factory architects.
Meaningful Choices — Recipe selection, apprentice assignment, enchantment allocation, and rebirth timing all require real tradeoffs. No single dominant strategy.
Rewarding Returns — Coming back after time away should feel good. Offline production, accumulated orders, and skill-up progress create a satisfying "catch-up" moment.
Discovery & Lore — Legendary recipes, named hero clients, and ancient forge lore provide narrative hooks beyond pure numbers. Each rebirth reveals more of the world's history.
